rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0001
rows.name:
Hm? Either you picked up another xeno
or someone's been holding their breath too long.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0002
rows.name: This is L. We met in Noctilum.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0003
rows.name:
We are L'cirufe, if it please you.
This planet has been our home since days of yore.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0004
rows.name: Oh? A longtime resident?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0005
rows.name:
That's why we brought him back.
His knowledge could prove invaluable.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0006
rows.name: I'd like to request permission for him to stay in New LA.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0007
rows.name:
We can't allow just anyone to waltz into our city on a whim.
How much do we know about him?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0008
rows.name: I know enough. Enough to say that we can trust him.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0009
rows.name: All Miran natives are good, honest folk![ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0010
rows.name:
Yes, Tatsu, yes.
Anyway, Elma, you do seem quite sure of yourself.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0011
rows.name: All right, I'll share the responsibility. He can stay.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0011_2
rows.name: If...that's acceptable, Mr. Director General?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0012
rows.name: If you're both certain—so be it.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0013
rows.name:
Many thanks, good sirs!
Truly, we are walking on the ninth cloud of seventh heaven![ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0014
rows.name: Please, call us L. The rest is far too formal.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0015
rows.name: And honestly, we prefer L anyway.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0016
rows.name:
More importantly, Colonel—
what happened with the Lifehold unit?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0017
rows.name: I see... So it wasn't the Core after all.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0018
rows.name: No. We confirmed it was one of the Archive units.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0019
rows.name: Unit Number 07.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0020
rows.name: 07? ...That would that be the LC repository, wouldn't it?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0021
rows.name: One of three, but yes.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0022
rows.name: The entirety of the Library of Congress archives.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0023
rows.name: As I recall, the data was stored on units 07 through 09.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0024
rows.name:
Well, thank God it wasn't the Core.
This situation coulda been a lot worse.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0025
rows.name: I wonder.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0026
rows.name: Hm?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0027
rows.name:
The LC archives contained nearly every
published work in mankind's history.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0028
rows.name:
It's not like it's just a bunch of
random books and manuscripts, you know?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0029
rows.name:
It's a history of human thought.
A record of opinions and emotions.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0030
rows.name: I mean, yeah, sure, but—[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0031
rows.name:
So if you stop and consider what it means
to lose even a third of that data?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0032
rows.name: It's a cultural and historical loss of catastrophic proportions.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0033
rows.name: [ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0034
rows.name: We do have parity data for the archives here.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0035
rows.name:
We know which unit was lost,
so hopefully we can find some way to restore it.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0036
rows.name: Let's hope so.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0037
rows.name: Moving on—[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0038
rows.name:
These "Ganglion"—you're certain
they were involved in the destruction of Earth?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0039
rows.name: Here. See for yourself.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0040
rows.name:
The left shot is from a battle over Beijing;
the right from our encounter.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0041
rows.name: Son of a... Is it possible this is their native planet?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0042
rows.name: Tatsu told us they aren't from here. And L confirmed it.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0043
rows.name: They're recent arrivals. Very recent.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0044
rows.name: So...either it's one hell of a coincidence, or they followed us.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0045
rows.name:
Considering they appear to be
systematically targeting the Lifehold,[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0046
rows.name: I'd say that leaves no question they followed us here.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0047
rows.name: Could they possibly know the purpose of the Lifehold?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0048
rows.name:
Maybe the whole reason we haven't found the Core yet
is 'cause those scumbags already trashed it?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0049
rows.name:
If so, none of us would be here
talking in the first place, would we?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0050
rows.name: Ah, you got a point there...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0051
rows.name: This information doesn't leave this room—[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0052
rows.name:
But we've had several recent Pathfinder reports
of xeno sightings and contact.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0053
rows.name: They may or may not be Ganglion...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0054
rows.name:
But regardless, I propose we double down
on our defenses going forward.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0055
rows.name:
That'll be all, Elma.
Please continue hunting for any signs of the Lifehold.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0056
rows.name: Yes, sir.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0057
rows.name: Remember, the clock is always ticking.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG0058
rows.name: We HAVE to find that unit before it's too late.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: xs04120100_MSG9000
rows.name: —BLADE Command Center—[ST:wait ]
